fields.title: home
fields.html:
Default page

You almost have COMIC framework up and running. Congratulations.
For up to date info, please visit https://github.com/comic/comic-django

On COMIC framework anyone can sign up and create a project. A project is a collection of pages, data and software under a single name.
The page you are reading now is the page "home" in the project "comic". The project "comic" is special in two ways:  First, it is shown by default if you navigate to the root url and second, it's pages appear as a menu below each and every page of the framework. To make a project other than 'comic' the main project, change the MAIN_PROJECT_NAME setting in comic/settings/00_default.conf.

useful code

At the base level a project in COMIC framework is a collection of html pages under a single header. Most if the interesting functionality comes from using django template tags which you can use as functions inside you html code. They look like { % render_graph results.csv % } and are rendered by django when encountered. A list of template tags can be found on page "template tags"

code for a sign in/ create new project button on a page:

 

{% if user.is_authenticated %} Create new project {% else %} Sign in to create a new project page

{% endif %}

 

{% allusers_statistics %}

fields.title: template_tags
fields.html:
Below is a list of all template tags which can be used on any page of the framework. For example, the table below is rendered by inserting { % taglist % } into the html of the page. Some template tags use additional arguments. These are described in the right column.

 

{% taglist %}

 

In addition, any built-in django template tag is also available.
